text: <@U13TWBRBL> - thanks. I was trying to keep an incremental counter in world state, something analogous to an auto increment in RDBMS. But I will have to face concurrency issues in that as I cannot commit & query (increment and return) in the same chaincode call.
OK. Another question. If ever all my peers go down, will I loseall my data? I mean its all a docker image. How to I save data to persistent storage?

<@U31A496G2> if docker instances crashed, when they are brought backup they should continue from the previous instance so you don’t lose anything, unless if for some reason the docker instances are deleted
<@U13TWBRBL> - I tried restarting my docker services, one peer at a time but I did not get my chaincodes deployed back. Is it something I am doing wrong?
the former would preserve any state, the latter starts a clean instance
<@U13TWBRBL> - Ahh. I did docker run. Thanks.
